title.value: Comparative evaluation of turnip-rooted celery varieties by the main economically valuable traits
Сравнительная оценка сортов сельдерея корневого по основным хозяйственно ценным признакам

journal.title: Vegetable Growing : collection of scientific papers

person.name: Oreshkov, A.N., Belarus State Academy of Agriculture, Gorki (Belarus)

abstract.value: In the conditions of the Republic of Belarus there were presented data on studying the comparative evaluation of turnip-rooted celery (Apium graveolens L.) varieties. The varieties for yield, sugar content, dry matter, vitamin C were marked. Research results showed that the optimal time for planting turnip-rooted celery in the conditions of Mogilev region (Belarus) is the third decade of April - early May. Turnip-rooted celery varieties Yudinka and Egor were characterized by a complex of economically important traits of the productive plant organ (mass and shape of root). According to the content of the basic biochemical indices (dry substance, vitamin C, etc.) the highest yielding varieties were Yudinka - 188.5 centner / ha and Egor - 182.7 kg / ha, according to the resistance to septariose - Egor variety.
